task.title: Grinding Valves
task.shortdesc: Learn how to properly grind valves using grinding paste and a specialized tool to ensure a smooth bearing surface.

ul.li: Obtain a good grinding paste (ground glass and oil from an auto supply house)
Work in a clean environment to prevent abrasive substances from entering cylinders
Never turn the valve through a complete revolution to avoid circumferential scratches
Prevent abrasive substances from entering cylinders or valve guides
If valve seat is severely worn or seamed, consider professional reseating

context.p: Valve grinding is a critical maintenance procedure that ensures proper valve seating and engine performance. Careful and precise execution is essential.

substep.cmd: Place a small amount of grinding paste in a suitable dish
Add a few drops of lubricating oil
Mix to create a thin paste

step.cmd: Apply grinding paste to the valve

substep.cmd: Apply the paste sparingly to the bevel face of the valve
Position the valve on the valve seat
Use the grinding tool to rotate the valve back and forth (about a quarter turn)
Lift the valve slightly from the seat
Continue until the bearing surface is smooth and bright
Remove the valve from the cylinder

result.p: A properly ground valve will have a smooth, bright bearing surface that ensures optimal engine performance and valve sealing.
